TopicTitle: Platform Enigma- an off topic chat thread.

Articles.Content:
moooo! Moooo! Moooooooo!!!
Kill it with fire!!!

[Chobit Alert system engaged]

I'd change me back if I were you.
*lock you in a pen* nope

Eww thats gross beyond words!

As my grandad once said - "You don't know gross until you've seen your friends blown into bits by a Nazi Grenade!".

Yeah, my grandad was pretty grim.

Oh yeah, this was at dinner after I remarked that the food looked gross. I was like 11.

*casts enigma*

*spell channeling*

*evolves into greater enigma*

...[Auth-C:October-Kepler. Delta-Elsplion engaged] *cow dies*

...

*Rips out of cows corpse with both hands as chainsaws*
*throws greater enigma at everyone without possibility to dodge/evade/escape*

Eww thats gross beyond words!

really? well you wouldn't want to see my creepy pasta story then

As my grandad once said - "You don't know gross until you've seen your friends blown into bits by a Nazi Grenade!".

Yeah, my grandad was pretty grim.

Oh yeah, this was at dinner after I remarked that the food looked gross. I was like 11.

Of course it has to be a Nazi grenade. I think every other grenade has the same effect.
unless chobit threw it

Of course it has to be a Nazi grenade. I think every other grenade has the same effect.

Hm, what?

He was a WW2 vet. He didn't much care for Nazis, nor do I. Although I find it bad that some people still hold prejudice toward Germans after the wars. That's stupid.

Hm, what?

He was a WW2 vet. He didn't much care for Nazis, nor do I. Although I find it bad that some people still hold prejudice toward Germans after the wars. That's stupid.

Don't worry. I wasn't being serious.

*unburies self from rubble*

*half of face is torn off*

Don't worry. I wasn't being serious.

Right. My bad.

Poes law and all that.

*GROWL* Model 24 grenade, NOT Nazi Grenade.

Stielhandgranates were in use since 1915.

Stielhandgranates were in use since 1915.

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/d9/Steilhandgranate_Schnittmodell_db.jpg

Everytime I see that, I remember Metal Slug.

*GROWL* Model 24 grenade, NOT Nazi Grenade.

Stielhandgranates were in use since 1915.

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/d9/Steilhandgranate_Schnittmodell_db.jpg

Look who's there! The great Empress! Could you please stop redwolfy from doing horrible things to us?
Oh God it's military chobit! *shoves Leon forward and GTFOs*

*GROWL* Model 24 grenade, NOT Nazi Grenade.

Stielhandgranates were in use since 1915.

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/d9/Steilhandgranate_Schnittmodell_db.jpg

Nazi grenade in the sense of a grenade thrown by a Nazi.

Give the old guy a break, I doubt he ever got close enough to examine the things anyway. Seeing as how he survived.

Everytime I see that, I remember Metal Slug.

Makes me think of CoD 5...

Blech, a CoDpiece.

My Grandfathers were WW2 vets as well, and both used correct terminology for each other's military equipment. (One was RCAF, the other was Luftwaffe)

It should also be noted that NSDAP and Wehrmacht were NOT the same entity.

Edited June 4, 2013 by chobit-389
My Grand-grandfather was actually in the SS but i don't know which rank he had.
my grand-great father served in WW2 dont know where or who though

Blech, a CoDpiece.

My Grandfathers were WW2 vets as well, and both used correct terminology for each other's military equipment. (One was RCAF, the other was Luftwaffe)

A CoDPiece? If that's what you want to call it then sure, but I'm also an ArmApiece and Battlefieldpiece along with YounameitI'veprobablyplayeditpiece.

Anyway, that's cool that your Grandads did that, and I'm sure mines did to, at least to his superiors. However I doubt he wanted to say to an 11 year old "by a Model 24 Stielhandgranate!" seeing as I'd have no clue what that is.
I have ancestor who fought in WWI and the other in WWII. Both are dead, but one of my grandma's has their war medals.
